meanings.definition: Capable of being shaped or formed easily.
meanings.sent1: The clay was malleably molded into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: The artist used the malleably clay to create intricate sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The malleably dough seemed to have a mind of its own, twisting into funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her opinions were as malleably as clay, changing with each new idea.
meanings.sent5: The metal wire was so malleably that it could be bent with just a gentle touch.

meanings.definition: Able to be easily influenced or changed.
meanings.sent1: His malleably nature made him agree with whatever others said.
meanings.sent2: The public opinion on the matter was malleably swayed by the new evidence.
meanings.sent3: The politician's promises were as malleably as a balloon animal at a party.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was malleably, bending to the will of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The weather in spring is as malleably as a child's mood, changing unpredictably.
